solution_line_template: Scott runs {miles_monday_wednesday_per_day} x {multiplier_twice_as_far} = <<{miles_monday_wednesday_per_day}*{multiplier_twice_as_far}={miles_thursday_friday_per_day}>>{miles_thursday_friday_per_day} miles every Thursday and Friday.

The total miles run by Scott for a week from Monday through Wednesday is {miles_monday_wednesday_per_day} x {num_days_mon_wed} = <<{miles_monday_wednesday_per_day}*{num_days_mon_wed}={total_miles_mon_wed}>>{total_miles_mon_wed} miles.

The total miles run by Scott for a week from Thursday to Friday is {miles_thursday_friday_per_day} x {num_days_thu_fri} = <<{miles_thursday_friday_per_day}*{num_days_thu_fri}={total_miles_thu_fri}>>{total_miles_thu_fri} miles.
So, in a week, Scott runs a total of {total_miles_mon_wed} + {total_miles_thu_fri} = <<{total_miles_mon_wed}+{total_miles_thu_fri}={total_miles_per_week}>>{total_miles_per_week} miles.
Thus, he runs a total of {total_miles_per_week} x {num_weeks_in_month} = <<{total_miles_per_week}*{num_weeks_in_month}={total_miles_per_month}>>{total_miles_per_month} miles in a month.
